subject: Doping
Bicycles and Bicycling
lead_paragraph: Giro d’Italia organizers have invited the Astana team to compete in the race, reversing an earlier decision to ban it because of doping scandals. Astana officials confirmed they are hurrying to get the elite American rider Levi Leipheimer from California to Palermo, Sicily, for the start of the three-week race on Saturday. The team had been shunned by cycling’s biggest events this year for involvement in doping scandals. Astana’s rebuilding work was rewarded late Friday, when Giro organizer RCS Sport offered the team a place.
